message.content:
<teammate-message teammate_id="team-lead" summary="Vote: draft Translator's Preface now or after?">
The author asks: should the translator write a draft of the Translator's Preface NOW (before full translation begins) to capture all the decisions while they're fresh â€” with the understanding it will be revised after translation is complete? Or should we wait until after?

Reply "NOW" or "AFTER" with a brief reason.
</teammate-message>

content.text: This message appears to be a stale/duplicate of the earlier exchange -- I already received the instruction to write the Preface draft NOW, wrote it, and sent confirmation to the team lead. Let me respond accordingly.

input.content:
This may be a stale message -- I already received the instruction to write the draft NOW, completed it, and sent you confirmation. The draft is at:

`/Users/el/Dropbox/10.Kernel/11.Vault/Tower/L. Legenravend/49 Workspace/Translator/Draft/Translators-Preface.md`

All 10 topics covered, marked as DRAFT, ~4,500 words across 9 sections. Ready for the author's review or next instructions.

But to answer the vote directly: **NOW**. The reasoning from all 9 expert reports, 7 resolved questions, and cross-cutting observations is fresh and integrated. A draft written now captures the full logic behind each decision. It can be revised after translation surfaces new micro-decisions, but the foundation will be solid.
input.summary: Already wrote the draft; confirming NOW vote
